p: On the local and regional levels, risks to food security have been identified in few V&As [ 54, 67]. In 2018, a high-level vulnerability assessment of Torontoâ€™s food system was conducted which explored the impacts of three hypothetical extreme weather events. The assessment highlighted that extreme weather events could impact food accessibility, distribution, and food safety [ 68]. The report recommended developing neighborhood-level food system resiliency plans for urban centers to address the unique needs of neighborhoods that may experience increased vulnerability during extreme weather events. The findings of the assessment support the argument for a coordinated effort across the food system to address vulnerabilities.
